by Station WHA at the University of Wisconsin. Written by Mrs. Fannie

Written, directed and produced by Elizabeth W. Cross. Broadcast February
23 1938, from 2:00 to 2:15 P.M. over Station WHAM, Rochester, New York.
HONORABLE MENTION. "Journeys in Music Land." Broadcast of February 23,
1938. One of the series of the Wisconsin School of the Air. Planned and
produced by Station WHA of the University of Wisconsin. Given without
script by Professor E. B. Gordon and student group. Broadcast February
23, 1938, from 2:00 to 2:15 P.M. over Station WHA, Madison, Wisconsin.

FIRST AWARD. "Carnival at Nice." From the series, "French for High
Schools," of the Wisconsin School of the Air. Planned and produced by
Station WHA of the University of Wisconsin. Written by Mile. Germaine
Mercier. Directed by Walter ICrulevitch and given by members of the Uni¬
versity French department. Broadcast January 14, 1938, from 11:30 to
11:45 A.M. over Station WHA, Madison, Wisconsin.
HONORABLE MENTION. "News Today, History Tomorrow." A weekly broadcast
of the Rochester School of the Air. Written, produced and given by Paul
C. Reed. Broadcast February 18, 1938 from 1:30 to 1:45 P.M. over Station
WHAM, Rochester, New York.

Company and the American Historical Association. Written, directed and
produced by Cesar Saerchmger. Broadcast Maroh 11, 1938 from 7,15 to
